intro: Barkhausia pinguis, commonly known as the smooth bark lichen, is a member of the Parmeliaceae family. It is a foliose lichen, characterized by its flat, leaf-like thallus that is typically greenish to yellowish in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with algae and cyanobacteria, which contribute to its photosynthetic ability. It is often found growing on tree trunks and rocks in humid, shaded environments. Its structure and composition make it an important indicator species for environmental conditions.
